p:
On the basis of the
Z i
statistic value, four types of spatial patterns were defined, namely, the High–High (HH) cluster, High–Low (HL) outlier, Low–Low (LL) cluster, and Low–High (LH) outlier. When the
Z i
statistic is larger than 1.64 (i.e., with a confidence level of 0.05), a unit with a large value of x i corresponds to an HH cluster, and a unit with a small value of x i is defined as an LL cluster. Similarly, when the
Z i
statistic is smaller to −1.64, a unit with a large value of x i is identified as an HL outlier, and a unit with a small value of x i is regarded as an LH outlier.
